Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the countryside, the ideals he intensively pursued before his unexpected death, the tremendous chaos and angst in the world after World War II, and the discord that continues to have a major impact on humankind today.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to fend for itself when its owners move away, has taken to killing the local food supply, endangering all of the town's residents. A teenaged girl, Rebecca, and her father are at odds over the killing of the cat, and Rebecca takes measures to ensure the animal's survival
